oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An account of how Tamme came to be 'dispossessed' of his people. Tamme and his mother are at the Makoba village. Tamme is persuaded to go into a Makoba's house. The Makoba refuses to allow Tamme to return to his mother and people. The Makoba eventually give Tamme to the Ovambo, who hand him over to white men (9167).
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: How Tamme was taken by the Makoba and given to the Ovambo
